item.title: Terms and Conditions
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
NO PURCHASE NECESSARY TO ENTER OR WIN, A PURCHASE WILL NOT INCREASE YOUR CHANCE OF WINNING. VOID WHERE PROHIBITED. The 2014 Topcoder Open ("Tournament") being held in four (4) online periods ("Periods") leading up to the onsite portion which will be held at Pier 48 at AT&T Park in San Francisco, California on November 16 - 19, 2014. The online portion of the Tournament will begin on July 1, 2013 and end on June 30, 2014. Your registration and participation in the 2014 Topcoder Open constitutes agreement with these terms and conditions ("Rules" or "Terms and Conditions") between you and topcoder, Inc. ("topcoder"). The first Period will begin on July 1, 2013 and end on September 30, 2013 The second Period will begin on October 1, 2013 and will end on December 31, 2013. The third Period will begin on January 1, 2014 and will end on March 31, 2014. The fourth Period will begin on April 1, 2014 and will end on June 30, 2014.

Entering the Tournament

The Tournament is brought to you by topcoder, Inc. and is designed to showcase the most prestigious members in the topcoder community. The Tournament consists of several competitions: Algorithm, Design, Development, Marathon, F2F, and Studio Design (each a "Competition"). The Tournament is open to all topcoder members who meet the criteria outlined herein and who register for the Tournament ("Competitors"). Registration for the Tournament automatically registers you for all Competitions and all Periods. For more information about the deadlines for participating in and the specific rules for each Competition, please refer to the specific area of these Rules for such Competition.

General Submission Requirements

All Competitors participating in a Competition will see a Submit option. Clicking the Submit link will take the Competitor to a page that will allow the Competitor to upload information about their submission in the Competition ("Submission"). The requirements for a Submission will vary depending on the Competition, so please refer to the specific area of these Rules for each Competition before submitting. Topcoder reserves the right at any time to disqualify a Submission from a Competition where, acting in good faith, it believes there are reasonable grounds to warrant disqualification, for example, if topcoder determines that the Submission does not provide the functionality described or required, or the Submission appears to be purposely designed to circumvent these Rules or the spirit of the Tournament and/or Competition.

How to participate

In order to determine how to participate in a Competition, please refer to the specific areas of these Rules for such Competition.

Conditions of Participation

Competitors must be registered members of topcoder, and also register for the Tournament. By participating in the Tournament and/or a Competition, you agree to be bound by these Rules and to all decisions of topcoder, which are final, binding and conclusive in all matters. As a condition of participating in this Tournament and/or a Competition and by submitting a Submission, each Competitor agrees to permit topcoder to describe, publicize, and link to your entry as described further below. Competitors must not cheat; all ideas for Submissions must be solely the Competitor's. Unless otherwise set forth in these Rules, Competitors may not collaborate on a Submission. IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE, YOU WARRANT THAT YOUR SUBMISSION FOR EACH COMPETITION:
  • Does not include or anticipate the inclusion of any unsuitable or offensive content, including nudity, sexually explicit, disparaging, libelous or other inappropriate content.
  • Does not include or anticipate the inclusion of any content that is in violation of or infringes third party intellectual property rights including, but not limited to copyrights, including music copyrights, trademarks, and rights of publicity.
  • Has not been entered in previous contests, or won previous awards.
  • Has not been published or distributed previously in any media.
  • Is suitable for a general audience;
  • Does not contain any claims that are not and cannot be substantiated or that would be false and/or misleading to a reasonable consumer.
All decisions relating to the viability of Submissions, the ranking of Submissions and all other matters pertaining to the Tournament, each Period and each Competition are within the sole discretion of topcoder or its designee and shall be final and binding in all respects. By participating in the Tournament and/or a Competition, a Competitor who wins a prize releases and agrees to hold harmless topcoder, its affiliates, subsidiaries, sponsors, advertising and promotion agencies, and prize suppliers, and all of their respective directors, officers, employees, representatives and agents, from and against any and all liability for any loss, property damage or damage to person, including without limitation, death and injury, due in whole or in part, directly or indirectly, from or arising out of participation in the Tournament and/or Competition, or participation in any Tournament and/or Competition-related activity, or the receipt, use or misuse of a prize. Topcoder reserves the right to limit the participation of any person in the Tournament and/or any Competition, amend or interpret these Rules or official communications governing the Tournament, a Period and each Competition or cancel the Tournament, a Period or any Competition for any reason with prior notice. Notices for any such amendment, interpretation or cancellation will be deemed to have been given by posting on the topcoder website and by virtue of a Competitor's continued participation in the Tournament, a Period and/or Competition. A Competitor may terminate participation in the Tournament, a Period and each Competition upon written notice to topcoder.

Eligibility

The Tournament and each Competition is open to all members of the topcoder website, who have agreed to the terms thereof, and who are at least 18 years of age at the time of registration. Competitors must be (i) a U.S. citizen, (ii) a lawful permanent resident of the U.S., (iii) a temporary resident, asylee, refugee of the U.S., or have a lawfully issued work authorization card permitting unrestricted employment in the U.S., or (iv) a non-U.S. resident authorized in the country in which the member resides while participating in the Tournament and each Competition to perform services as an independent contractor; or (v) with respect to the Algorithm and Marathon Competitions, be in the United States under a valid and current visa issued by the United States government which does not prohibit receiving a cash prize. Unless otherwise stated in the rules of a Competition, a Competitor is not eligible for the Tournament or a Competition if he/she is a resident of the Quebec province of Canada, Iran, Cuba, North Korea, Sudan or Syria. In addition, a Competitor is not eligible for the Tournament or a Competition if the Competitor is on the Specially Designated National list promulgated and amended, from time to time, by the United States Department of the Treasury. All Competitors must be registered members of topcoder, and must have agreed to these Rules prior to and as a condition for registering for the Tournament and participating in a Competition. Competitors must abide by the Terms of Use of topcoder's website at www.topcoder.com. Violation of the Terms of Use may result in disqualification from the Tournament and a Competition, and/or further consequences as determined in topcoder's sole discretion. Current employees of topcoder and those involved in the development, production (including prize suppliers and sponsors), implementation and distribution of the Tournament, a Period or a Competition and their advertising or promotion agencies, parent companies, service providers, agents, officers, subsidiaries or affiliates, or any other persons or entities directly associated with the Tournament and members of their immediate families and/or persons living in the same household as such persons, are ineligible to enter the Tournament, a Period or a Competition. Current employees of any Sponsor of the Tournament, a Period or a Competition or their parent companies, subsidiaries or affiliates which Sponsor is involved in the preparation, administration or judging of the Tournament, a Period or a Competition and members of their employees' immediate families and/or persons living in the same household as such employees, are ineligible to enter the Tournament, such Period or such Competition.

General Information About Prizes

All cash prizes are listed and shall be awarded in USD. All prizes will be awarded in each Competition, provided a qualified number of Submissions are received and the requisite number of Competitors participate in a Round of a Competition. If a Competitor cannot or will not accept a prize, then the prize will be forfeited and may be awarded to the next highest scoring Submission. Unless otherwise provided herein, by participating in the Tournament and a Competition, a Competitor acknowledges and agrees that if his/her Submission is selected as a winner, the Competitor will receive a cash award only upon verification of all applicable eligibility requirements. Cash prizes will be paid out by topcoder (or its designee) in the US in US dollars no later than 90 days following the conclusion of the Tournament or a Period and Competition. Taxes, if any, are the sole responsibility of the winner(s). Prizes which remain unclaimed or undeliverable for a period of six (6) months will be forfeited. As a condition of winning and redeeming a cash prize, Competitors will be required to submit a completed (i) Competitor Questionnaire and all post tournament surveys, (ii) Affidavit of Eligibility and Liability and Publicity Release, unless a notarized copy is already on file with topcoder (iii) IRS Form W-9 or W-8BEN, as appropriate if one is not already on file with topcoder, (iv) topcoder Competition Assignment Agreement, if one is not already on file with topcoder, and (v) Travel form. In completing the Affidavit of Eligibility and Liability and Publicity Release, a Competitor who wins a cash prize (a) confirms his/her eligibility, (b) represents and warrants that he/she has not cheated, (c) verifies the accuracy of the demographic information submitted to, and contained in, the topcoder member database, (d) authorizes topcoder to publicize the results of the Tournament and/or Competition, (e) agrees to sign any applicable forms required by tax authorities, (f) grants topcoder a license to all information submitted during the Tournament and the Competition, and (g) releases topcoder from liability arising out of any prize won. topcoder requires Competitors to complete the Form W-9 or W-8BEN for tax reporting purposes. Providing false information in the registration process or in the required forms described in this paragraph will result in a forfeiture of a cash prize. If a winning Competitor (i) does not reply to a notification from topcoder or the notification is undeliverable, (ii) does not return the Affidavit of Eligibility/Liability/Publicity release completed and signed within ten (10) days of date of prize notification, or (iii) is not otherwise in compliance with these Rules or the rules of a Competition, the Competitor will be disqualified and forfeit any prize, and topcoder may, at our discretion, select and notify another Competitor. Participatory prizes and non-cash prizes will be mailed within one month following the conclusion of the Tournament or a Period and/or Competition to the address provided by the Competitor in their topcoder profile as of Wednesday, September 24, 2014. Unclaimed or undeliverable participatory prizes will be forfeited. Competitors who do not submit the required information by the applicable deadlines forfeit their prizes. Please allow 6-12 weeks for delivery. If your prize is returned, topcoder will resend your prize to a secondary address provided a request is made by the prizewinning Competitor. topcoder is not responsible for lost or stolen items and will not send additional prizes in the event a prize is not received. Each Competitor is eligible to receive only one (1) limited edition 2014 Topcoder Open T-shirt during the Tournament.

License to Submissions

As a condition of participation, Competitors hereby grant a perpetual, royalty-free, irrevocable, non-exclusive license to topcoder (a) to use, reproduce and publish Submissions or material submitted in connection with the Tournament or Competition; (b) to publicly display, and/or feature your Submission and all its content and all submitted material in connection with the promotion of the Tournament or the Competition in all media (now known or later developed); and (c) store your Submission, its content and submitted material on topcoder's servers, for marketing purposes, and/or for the promotion of the Tournament and/or the Competition. You agree to sign any necessary documentation that may be required by topcoder or its designees to make use of the rights you granted above. You also understand and acknowledge that topcoder, any Tournament or Competition sponsor(s), and/or other Competitors may have developed or commissioned materials similar or identical to your Submission and you waive any claims you may have resulting from any similarities to your Submission. Nothing in these Rules shall be construed as granting you any right or license under any intellectual property right of topcoder or any Tournament or Competition sponsor(s) (including any rights they may have in any patents, copyrights, trademarks, service marks or any trade secrets) or in topcoder's web site, by implication, high estoppel or otherwise, except as may be expressly set forth herein.

Confirmation

All Competitors who have advanced or won a trip to the onsite portion of the Tournament ("Onsite Competitors") must arrive at the event no later than 12:00 UTC -7 (PST) on November 16, 2014. All Onsite Competitors must confirm their attendance at the onsite event no later than Wednesday, September 24, 2014. In order to confirm attendance, Onsite Competitors must have acquired any necessary travel visas and confirm their ability to travel to the United States no later than Wednesday, September 24, 2014. If an Onsite Competitor is required to travel from outside the United States, the Onsite Competitor must show proof of a visa and/or passport by Wednesday, September 24, 2014. Onsite Competitors may email a copy of their documents to Jessie D'Amato Ford. Onsite Competitors who fail to meet this requirement may be replaced as an Onsite Competitor. Competitors who are otherwise eligible to compete in any or all of the Competitions will be permitted to participate in the online portions of any/all of them. However, in the event a Competitor advances to the onsite finals in more than one Competition and any of the times for the onsite rounds of the Competitions overlap, the Onsite Competitor may participate in either, but not both, Competitions. The Onsite Competitor must notify topcoder of the Competition in which she/he will participate as an Onsite Competitor no later than Wednesday, September 24, 2014.

Visa Assistance

Topcoder will issue visa invitation letters (upon request) to international Competitors who require one to obtain a travel visa to enter the United States. All registered TCO14 Competitors may request a visa invitation letter. Competitors must fill out the visa letter request  form in its entirety before a visa letter will be mailed. Competitors have until Friday, September 5, 2014 to request a letter. Visas can take a significant amount of time to obtain in certain countries, so it is in a Competitor's best interests to request one well before the deadline. The cost of obtaining a visa is the sole responsibility of the Competitor. See more information about travel visas. The Tournament involves a large number of visa applications by topcoder members. By applying for a visa to attend the Tournament, you understand that topcoder will cooperate with all requests by consulates, the Department of Homeland Security, and law enforcement in connection with such Competitor's visa, including information about the visa applicants' attendance at the Tournament. Any abuse of the visa application process or any visa obtained for the Tournament is considered a serious violation of US law and these Rules, and, among other things, the Competitor will be subject to discipline by topcoder.

Travel Details

Topcoder will provide air travel arrangements for each Onsite Competitor. The flight will be reserved and paid for by topcoder. Onsite Competitors will arrive on Sunday, November 16 and depart the day after the final day of the tournament, Thursday, November 20, 2014. At topcoder's sole discretion, topcoder will pay for each Onsite Competitor's airfare up to $1,500, but reserves the right to make exceptions to the maximum amount based on individual circumstances. If an Onsite Competitor wishes to take a flight other than the one provided by topcoder and/or wishes to stay at a hotel other than the one provided by topcoder, the Onsite Competitor shall be responsible for the entire cost of such deviation from the accommodations and travel arrangements provided by topcoder. In addition, the Onsite Competitor agrees to reimburse topcoder for any costs, penalties, fines or fees incurred by topcoder as a result of such deviation. Ground transportation to and from the airport will be provided for each Onsite Competitor by topcoder, as well as private hotel accommodations and certain meals. All other expenses are the responsibility of the Onsite Competitor. topcoder will not provide travel, lodging accommodations, or visa assistance for any guests of an Onsite Competitor. If an Onsite Competitor is eliminated or chooses not to utilize the travel accommodations provide by topcoder for any reason after he/she is confirmed as a finalist and travel accommodations have already been made for the Onsite Competitor by topcoder for the onsite finals, that Onsite Competitor may be held responsible for reimbursing topcoder for the cost of such accommodations. topcoder reserves the right to withhold any future cash prizes won by the Onsite Competitor until the cost of such accommodations has been fully reimbursed. Onsite Competitors must complete the following items and submit them to topcoder by Wednesday, September 24, 2014 (failure to submit these items will disqualify an Onsite Competitor from advancing to the onsite event):
  • Confirmation of attendance/proof of travel documents – Please email Jessie D'Amato Ford to confirm your attendance onsite. If you require a passport and/or visa to visit the United States, you must show proof of your documents.
  • Please submit a member photo, if you have not already done so.
  • Please also submit a fun photo to be shared during your onsite introduction.
  • Please ensure the information listed in your topcoder profile is current. We may need to mail your plane tickets or contact you via telephone.
  • Complete the Onsite Competitor Questionnaire – your responses may be published in the program for the Tournament.
  • Travel form – provide topcoder with the appropriate travel information for your trip to the onsite event.
  • Topcoder Competition Assignment Agreement – topcoder must receive an executed copy of the Agreement unless an executed Agreement is already on file with topcoder. The Agreement must be received topcoder no later than a date Wednesday, September 24, 2014.
  • Applicable tax forms (unless one is already on file with topcoder).

Indemnification and Release

By submitting a Submission and/or otherwise participating in forum and newsgroup discussions on topcoder's customer and developer forums, Competitor agrees to indemnify topcoder and any parent, subsidiary or affiliated entities, topcoder's officers and employees, and officers and employees of any parent, subsidiary or affiliated entities and hold them harmless from any and all claims and expenses, including attorney's fees, arising from Competitor's use of topcoder's website(s) and/or the materials gained from topcoder's website(s) or directly from topcoder, including any material (including third party material) that Competitor posts on topcoder's website(s) or in any news forums and any services or products available through topcoder's website(s). In addition, Competitor hereby releases topcoder and any parent, subsidiary or affiliated entities, topcoder's officers and employees, and officers and employees of any parent, subsidiary or affiliated entities from any and all claims, demands, debts, obligations, damages (actual or consequential), costs, and expenses of any kind or nature whatsoever, whether known or unknown, suspected or unsuspected, disclosed or undisclosed, that Competitor may have against them arising out of or in any way related to such disputes and/or to any services or products available at topcoder's website(s). Competitor hereby agrees to waive all laws that may limit the efficacy of such releases. By registering and/or participating in the Tournament or a Competition the Competitor agrees to release topcoder and any Competition sponsor(s), and its affiliates and agents, and the officers, employees, affiliates, advertising and promotions agencies, prize suppliers, and all of their employees, officers, directors, shareholder's and agents (collectively, the "Releasees") from any and all liability or any injuries, loss or damage of any kind arising from or in connection with the Tournament or a Competition, the use of any Submission, or the acceptance or use of any prize won, except where prohibited by law. Releasees assume no responsibility for incomplete, misdirected, damaged or illegible entries nor for any delayed Submissions or those not received for whatever reason, including without limitation due to internet or e-mail server failure, telephone, human, or other higherror or for any technical or other malfunctions that may occur including any injury or damage to Competitor's or any other person's computer relating to or resulting from participation in the Tournament or a Competition or downloading any materials during or for the Tournament or a Competition.

DISCLAIMER

THE MATERIALS AND SERVICES ON topcoder'S WEBSITE(S) ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" AND WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMISSIBLE PURSUANT TO APPLICABLE LAW, topcoder DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. topcoder DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE FUNCTIONS CONTAINED IN THE MATERIALS WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE, THAT DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED, OR THAT topcoder'S WEBSITE(S) OR THE SERVER(S) THAT MAKES topcoder'S WEBSITE(S) AVAILABLE OR ANY ADVERTISED OR HYPERLINKED SITE ARE FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS OR THAT topcoder'S WEBSITE(S), SERVER(S), ADVERTISED OR HYPERLINKED SITES WILL BE ACCESSIBLE AT ALL TIMES. topcoder DOES NOT WARRANT THAT SUCH ERRORS, DEFECTS OR INTERRUPTIONS IN SERVICE WILL NOT AFFECT THE RESULTS OF ITS COMPETITIONS AND SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT PROCESS, AND topcoder DISCLAIMS ANY RESPONSIBILITY FOR REDUCED PERFORMANCE OR INOPERABILTIY IN COMPETITIONS OR IN SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT DUE TO SUCH PROBLEMS. topcoder DOES NOT WARRANT OR MAKE ANY REPRESENTATIONS REGARDING THE USE OR THE RESULTS OF ITS WEBSITE(S) WITH RESPECT TO CORRECTNESS, ACCURACY, RELIABILITY OR OTHERWISE. YOU ASSUME THE ENTIRE COST OF ALL NECESSARY SERVICING, REPAIR OR CORRECTION. TO THE EXTENT THAT APPLICABLE LAW MAY NOT ALLOW THE EXCLUSION OF IMPLIED WARRANTIES, THE ABOVE EXCLUSIONS MAY NOT APPLY TO YOU. Documents, graphics and other materials appearing at topcoder's website(s) may include technical inaccuracies, typographical higherrors, and out-of-date information and use of such documents, graphics or other materials is at Competitor's own risk.

LIMITATION OF LIABILITY

TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMISSIBLE PURSUANT TO APPLICABLE LAW, topcoder SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES (INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES), INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF WINNINGS, DATA OR OTHER DAMAGE TO ANY OTHER INTANGIBLE PROPERTY, EVEN IF topcoder HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, RESULTING FROM (i) THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE ITS WEBSITE(S), (ii) THE POSTING OF INFORMATION TO, OR THE RECEIPT OF INFORMATION FROM, ITS WEBSITE(S), (iii) THE DISCLOSURE OF, UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO OR ALTERATION OF ANY TRANSMISSION OR DATA, (iv) THE STATEMENTS OR CONDUCT OF ANY THIRD PARTY OR (v) ANY OTHER MATTER RELATING TO topcoder.

Choice of Law and Forum

These Rules are governed by the laws of the State of Connecticut. Competitor hereby agrees to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Connecticut. To the extent that applicable laws have mandatory application to these Rules or give Competitor the right to bring action in any other courts, the above limitations may not apply to such Competitor. Use of topcoder's website(s) and participation in the Tournament or a Competition is unauthorized in any jurisdiction that does not give full effect to all provisions of these Rules.

Severability and Enforceability

If any provision or portion of these Rules is held illegal, invalid, or unenforceable, in whole or in part, it shall be modified to the minimum extent necessary to correct any deficiencies or replaced with a provision which is as close as is legally permissible to the provision found invalid or unenforceable and shall not affect the legality, validity or enforceability of any other provisions or portions of these Rules.

Privacy

All information is collected in the United States, and the use of any personally identifiable information is subject to the terms of the topcoder Privacy Statement located here. By entering or participating in the Tournament, a Period or a Competition, the Competitor acknowledges that topcoder and any Competition sponsor will collect, process and use the personal data provided by the Competitor in connection with and for the purpose of administering of the Tournament and a Competition, including disclosure of names and other information to third parties (e.g., hotels, travel agencies, consulates, etc...).

Termination/Exclusion

Topcoder reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to revoke any and all privileges associated with the Tournament, a Period and a Competition, and to take any other action it deems appropriate including but not limited to disqualification of a Submission or terminating or suspending a Competitor's use of www.topcoder.com and/or www.topcodersoftware.com for no reason or any reason whatsoever, including improper use of its website(s) or failure to comply with these Rules, or the Terms of Use of topcoder's websites, which are incorporated herein by reference. If for any reason the Tournament, a Period or a Competition is not capable of running as planned due to infection by computer virus, bugs, tampering, unauthorized intervention, fraud, technical failures, uploads of malicious files or viruses, or any other causes beyond the control of topcoder which corrupt or affect the administration, security, fairness, integrity, or proper conduct of the Tournament, a Period or a Competition, topcoder reserves the right at its sole discretion, to disqualify any entry or any individual who tampers with the entry or judging process, and to cancel, terminate, modify or suspend the Tournament, a Period or a Competition and select winners using all eligible, non-suspect Submissions received as of the date of termination. Releasees assume no responsibility for any higherror, omission, interruption, deletion, defect, delay in operation or transmission, communications line failure, theft or destruction or unauthorized access to, or alteration of, Submissions. CAUTION: ANY ATTEMPT TO DELIBERATELY DAMAGE ANY WEBSITE OR UNDERMINE THE LEGITIMATE OPERATION OF THE TOURNAMENT OR A COMPETITION IS A VIOLATION OF CRIMINAL AND CIVIL LAWS AND SHOULD SUCH AN ATTEMPT BE MADE, topcoder RESERVES THE RIGHT TO SEEK DAMAGES TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW.

Competition Specific Rules

For rules specific to the Algorithm Competition, here. For rules specific to the Design Competition, please refer here. For rules specific to the Development Competition, please refer here. For rules specific to the Marathon Competition, here. For rules specific to the F2F Competition, please refer here. For rules specific to the Studio Design Competition, please refer here.

Other

The Tournament and each Competition is void in whole or in part where prohibited by law. A list of winners by handles for the Tournament, each Period and each Competition will be available on the web site at http://www.topcoder.com/ displayed for at least 3 months after the end of the Tournament, each Period and each Competition. Topcoder may assign, novate or subcontract any or all of its rights and obligations under these Rules at any time. The Tournament and each Competition is brought to you by topcoder, Inc., 95 Glastonbury Boulevard, Glastonbury, CT 06033 Telephone: (860) 633-5540. If you have any questions regarding these Rules, contact us at service@topcoder.com. All trademarks, tradenames, and/or tradestyles used in the Tournament and a Competition are the sole property of the respective owners of such trademarks, tradenames, and/or tradestyles and are used herein solely for identification purposes.

item.title: About TCO
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
What happens when you put the most elite coders and designers on a stage to compete head to head on some of the toughest problems? What happens when you are face to face with genius minds, innovative thinkers, and industry leaders? What happens when rival tech companies from across the globe collaborate their support?

The Topcoder Open happens.

The Topcoder Open (TCO) is a world-wide programming and designing tournament that takes place for an entire year before narrowing down the best of the best for the ultimate showdown live on stage! Dating back to 2001, topcoder tournaments have paved the way for geeks of all kinds. Champions and finalists of topcoder tournaments enjoy many perks including meeting presidents, starting big businesses, having their own wiki page, and becoming millionaires. Not to mention working their dream job at Facebook, Google, NSA, and Intel to name a few. Whether you compete for the glory, for the job, or to meet other like minded folks, the prize money and trip to the event is not a bad gig either! TCO15 is giving out tons of prizes and trip to the onsite finals which we will be announcing soon! Any topcoder member 18 years or older and who meet all the eligibility criteria can compete in the TCO and there are six different tracks of competition to try. How can you compete? Most all topcoder competitions are eligible for TCO points. Check out what challenges are running now. Compete today!

item.title: Important Information Needed
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
Please read all instructions carefully before proceeding and the FAQs we put together for you. Congratulations on your performance in the 2015 Topcoder Open. To be completed by 17:00 UTC -4 Wednesday, September 24, 2014:
  • UPDATE YOUR MEMBER PROFILE -your member profile must be accurate and complete. You will not receive any cash or prizes unless your profile is complete.
  • MEMBER FORM - Please confirm your attendance, provide proof of travel documents, fill out questionnaire, and upload your photo here.
  • TAX FORM - Please fill out by Wednesday, September 24, 2014. (If you already have one on file, you do not need to do this again). Find Form W-9 here (W9) for US folks and find Form W-8BEN here (W8) for non US folks.
  • TRAVEL FORM - Please note that once you submit your travel form your flight will be booked.  Make sure all relevant travel information is included here.  Travel FAQs can be viewed here.
Reminder, you will not be able to attend the onsite event unless all above items are completed by 17:00 UTC-4 on September 24, 2014. If you have questions, please contact Jessie D’Amato Ford. PLEASE NOTE:  As per the tournament rules, all prize winners must complete post tournament surveys before they can receive their prize.  After the conclusion of the TCO15 onsite event, you will receive a post tournament survey with deadlines.  The survey must be completed by the deadline in order to receive your TCO winnings.

item.title: Information Architecture
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
The Information Architecture (IA) Competition includes the following tracks: Wireframes and some new IA tracks to be determined. Tracks included in this competition can be added or removed at topcoder’s sole discretion. Competitors will have from August 1, 2014 – June 30, 2015 to compete and accumulate points leading up to the Finals, being held at a location and dates to be determined soon. The top three scorers for each period will win this fabulous trip, the top scorer from each period wins a big prize, and the top twelve scorers overall will win the cash prizes!

How Does it Work?

First you must become a topcoder member. Become a member and get started competing here! Learn all about the Information Architecture Competition here.

The Competition Details

  • When is the competition? See the schedule.
  • It is important for you to read the official rules and regulations for important details. Also, you must read through the specific rules for the Information Architecture Competition.
  • The competition is free but you must be a member who is 18 years or older, as well as meet all eligibility criteria, in order to participate.

item.title: Rules
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
[tco_collapsible title="The Rules"] The 2015 Topcoder Open Information Architecture Competition will take place online between August 1, 2014 and June 30, 2015 (“IA Competition”). The IA Competition will consist of online qualifying Competitions, with up to twelve (12) of the highest scoring Contestants across all four (4) periods (each, a “Period” and collectively, the “Information Architecture Competition Period”) winning a trip to competed at the onsite Tournament at a location TBD. The IA Competition will include the following tracks of competition: Wireframes and some new IA tracks TBD. Tracks included in the IA Competition can be added or removed at topcoder’s sole discretion. Contestants are only eligible to win one trip in the Information Architecture Competition of the onsite Tournament through the Information Architecture Competition and if the Contestant has already won a trip to the onsite Tournament, the next highest scoring Contestant may win a trip if that Contestant has greater than 0 placement points in that Round. The Information Architecture Competition is part of the Tournament, and by participating in this Information Architecture Competition, you agree to these rules and the topcoder Terms of Use. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Schedule"] During the Information Architecture Competition Period, Contestants who have registered for the Tournament no later than June 30, 2015 and who participate in Tournament-eligible Information Architecture Competitions, will receive points as outlined in these Rules. A Contestant’s submission will not be scored separately for the Information Architecture Competition. Only Tournament-eligible Competitions in which registration has started during the (4) Periods shall be included in determining points for the Information Architecture Competition. For the final Period, only Tournament-eligible Competitions which have started and ended during the Period shall be included in determining points for the Information Architecture Competition. [tco_schedule category="Online Competition Dates" headers="Information Architecture Online Competition Dates," colspan="2" colwidth="50%"] Onsite Rounds The onsite round schedule will be made available at a later date. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Competition Scoring"] Scoring in the Information Architecture Competition and each Period is determined based on the final placement for a Contestant’s submission in a Tournament-eligible Information Architecture competition in accordance with the rules of such competition. A Competition is Tournament-eligible if the Competition is identified as being included as part of the Tournament . All Submissions will proceed through screening policies. Submissions that fail screening will not be eligible for placement points in the Information Architecture Competition. Only Contestants who are registered for the Tournament will be considered in determining place and placement points. Placement scoring is as follows: [tables colwidth="50%"], Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,11 Points Second Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,9 Points Third Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,7 points Fourth Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,4 Points Fifth Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,1 Point [/tables] [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Advancement"] Upon the completion of all Tournament-eligible Information Architecture contests in a Period, all of the individual placement scores that a Contestant receives during that Period will be added for a cumulative placement score for the Period. Up to three (3) Contestants with the highest cumulative placement score during each Period will advance to the Onsite Championship (“Onsite Information Architecture Contestants”). Up to twelve (12) total Contestants from the four (4) Periods will advance to compete in the Onsite Championship. In the event of a tie, the tie will be resolved in the following manner:
  • The tied Contestant who has the most 1st place submissions in Tournament-eligible Information Architecture contests within the Period shall advance.
  • If a tie still remains, then the remaining tied Contestant who has the most 2nd place Submissions in Tournament-eligible Information Architecture contests within the Period shall advance.
  • If a tie still remains, then all remaining tied Contestants will advance.
Example: [tables]Case,Contestant #1,Contestant #2,Result Period 1,12,10,Contestant #1 would advance. Period 2,12,12,Check the number of 2nd place wins Period 3,10,7,Contestant #1 would advance. and so on...,,, [/tables] [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Onsite Rounds"] Onsite Competition Information A portion of the Information Architecture Competition will take place at the onsite Tournament. More details about the onsite portion of the Information Architect Competition will be announced in early 2015. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="About the Prizes"] The Information Architecture Competition will award up to $25,000 in cash prizes. Any and all applicable taxes on prizes are the sole responsibility of the prizewinner. [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 1 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the onsite Tournament ("TCO15") 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 2 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 3 Online Winners,Prize 3 Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 4 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Onsite Winners,Prize Onsite Champion, $10\,000 2nd place finisher*, $3\,000 3rd place finisher*, $1\,000 4th place finisher*, $300 5th place finisher*, $100 6th place finisher*, $100 7th place finisher*, $100 8th place finisher*, $100 9th place finisher*, $100 10th place finisher*, $100 11th place finisher*, $100 [/tables] * Prize will be awarded after the conclusion of the Championship Round. Winner must be present at the onsite Awards presentation to receive prize. [/tco_collapsible]

item.title: Prototype
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
The Prototype Competition includes the following tracks: UI Prototype, Architecture, Conceptualization, and Specification. Tracks included in this competition can be added or removed at topcoder’s sole discretion. Competitors will have from August 1, 2014 – June 30, 2015 to compete and accumulate points leading up to the Finals, being held at a location and dates to be determined soon. The top three scorers for each period will win this fabulous trip, the top scorer from each period wins a big prize, and the top twelve scorers overall will win the cash prizes!

How Does it Work?

First you must become a topcoder member. Become a member and get started competing here! Learn all about the Prototype Competition here.

The Competition Details

  • When is the competition? See the schedule.
  • It is important for you to read the official rules and regulations for important details. Also, you must read through the specific rules for the Prototype Competition.
  • The competition is free but you must be a member who is 18 years or older, as well as meet all eligibility criteria, in order to participate.

item.title: Rules
item.dc:creator: quesks
item.content:encoded:
[tco_collapsible title="The Rules"] TCO15’s Prototype Competition will take place online between August 1, 2014 and June 30, 2015 (“Prototype Competition”). The Prototype Competition will consist of online qualifying contests, with up to twelve (12) of the highest scoring Contestants across all four (4) periods (each a “Period” and collectively, the “Prototype Competition Period”) winning a trip to the onsite Tournament and to compete at the Onsite Championship. The Prototype Competition will include the following tracks of competition: UI Prototype, Architecture, Conceptualization, and Specification. Tracks included in the Prototype Competition may be added or removed at topcoder’s sole discretion. Contestants are only eligible to win one trip to the onsite Tournament through the Prototype Competition and if the Contestant has already won a trip to the onsite Tournament through the Prototype Competition, the next highest scoring Contestant may win a trip if they have placement points greater than 0 in that Period. The Prototype Competition is part of the Tournament, and by participating in this Information Architecture Competition, you agree to these rules and the topcoder Terms of Use. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Schedule"] During the Prototype Competition Period, Contestants who participate in Tournament-eligible prototype contests will receive points as outlined in these Rules. A Contestant’s submission will not be scored separately for the Prototype Competition. Only Tournament-eligible prototype contests in which registration has started during the four Periods shall be included in determining points for the Prototype Competition. [tco_schedule category="Online Competition Dates" headers="Prototype Online Competition Dates," colspan="2" colwidth="50%"] Onsite Rounds The onsite round schedule will be made available at a later date. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Competition Scoring"] Scoring in the Prototype Competition and each Period is determined based on the final placement for a Contestant’s Submission in a Tournament-eligible prototype contest in accordance with the rules of such Competition. A prototype contest is a Tournament-eligible Competition if it is identified by topcoder as being included as part of the Tournament . Placement scoring is as follows: [tables colwidth="50%"], Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,11 Points Second Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,9 Points Third Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,7 points Fourth Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,4 Points Fifth Highest Scoring Registered Contestant,1 Point [/tables] [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Advancement"] Upon the completion of all Tournament-eligible prototype contests in a Period, all of the individual placement scores that a Contestant receives during that Period will be added for a cumulative placement score for the Period. Up to three (3) Contestants with the highest cumulative placement score during each Period will advance to the Onsite Championship (“Onsite Prototype Contestants”) as part of the onsite Tournament. Up to twelve (12) total Contestants from the four (4) Periods will advance to compete in the Onsite Championship. In the event of a tie, the tie will be resolved in the following manner:
  • The tied Contestant who has the most 1st place submissions in Tournament-eligible Prototype contests within the Period shall advance.
  • If a tie still remains, then the remaining tied Contestant who has the most 2nd place submissions in Tournament-eligible Prototype contests within the Period shall advance.
  • If a tie still remains, then all remaining tied Contestants will advance.
Example: [tables]Case,Contestant #1,Contestant #2,Result Period 1,12,10,Contestant #1 would advance. Period 2,12,12,Check the number of 2nd place wins Period 3,10,7,Contestant #1 would advance. and so on...,,, [/tables] [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="Onsite Rounds"] Onsite Competition Information There will be a onsite competition portion for the Prototype Competition. More details about the onsite portion of the Prototype Competition will be announced in early 2015. [/tco_collapsible] [tco_collapsible title="About the Prizes"] The Prototype Competition will award up to $25,000 in cash prizes. Any and all applicable taxes on prizes are the sole responsibility of the prizewinner. [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 1 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the onsite Tournament ("TCO15") 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 2 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 3 Online Winners,Prize 3 Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Period 4 Online Winners,Prize Champion,$2\,500 and a trip to the TCO15 2nd place,Trip to TCO15 3rd place,Trip to TCO15 [/tables] [tables colwidth="50%"]Onsite Winners,Prize Onsite Champion, $10\,000 2nd place finisher*, $3\,000 3rd place finisher*, $1\,000 4th place finisher*, $300 5th place finisher*, $100 6th place finisher*, $100 7th place finisher*, $100 8th place finisher*, $100 9th place finisher*, $100 10th place finisher*, $100 11th place finisher*, $100 [/tables] * Prize will be awarded after the conclusion of the Championship Round. item.title: The TCO15 Has Begun!
item.dc:creator: jmpld40
item.content:encoded:
We are very excited to announce the 2015 Topcoder Open! Here are the highlights for TCO15:
  1. We have new competition tracks: Information Architecture and Prototype! The complete list of tracks include Algorithm, Development, Information Architecture, Marathon, Prototype, and UI Design.
  2. You do not need to register specifically for TCO in order to compete in the online rounds and become a finalist. If you compete in a TCO-eligible challenge, you will get TCO points.
  3. If you win first place in a Period, you win extra cash and are considered an Online Champion!
  4. All tracks will compete live at the TCO15 onsite finals!
We look forward to sharing more details as they emerge for this awesome tournament. In the mean time, post in this forum if you have questions.
